Data.event_text: 8 January  Twenty-five people are killed and six others are injured in a crash involving a truck and a tourist minibus on a highway near São José do Jacuípe, Bahia.

links.text: -"25 killed and 6 injured in collision between minibus and truck in Brazil's northeast". ABC News. Retrieved 2024-01-09.-

Data.event_text: 15 January  Heavy rains kill 11 people in Rio de Janeiro.

links.text: -"Photos: Torrential rains leave at least 11 dead in Brazil". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-01-15.-

Data.event_text: 20 January  A magnitude 6.6 earthquake strikes Acre and Amazonas states, making it the strongest recorded earthquake to hit Brazil. No casualties or damage are reported.

links.text: -"Brazil Experiences Its Largest Recorded Earthquake". The Rio Times. 2024-01-21.-

Data.event_text: 29 January  A Piper PA-46 crashes in a rural area of Itapeva, Minas Gerais, killing seven people on board.

links.text: -"'Tragédia', descreve testemunha sobre queda de avião monomotor que matou 7 pessoas no Sul de Minas". O Globo (in Brazilian Portuguese). 2024-01-28. Retrieved 2024-01-29.-

Data.event_text: 22 February  At least eight people are killed during floods and landslides in Rio de Janeiro State.

links.text: -"8 people die in Brazil's Rio de Janeiro state as heavy rains cause landslides and floods". AP News. 2024-02-23. Retrieved 2024-02-23.-

Data.event_text: 21 February  8 May  2024 Copa Verde football competition is held.

links.text: -"CBF divulga datas da Copa Verde 2024; confira" [CBF announces dates for Copa Verde 2024; check out] (in Brazilian Portuguese). Globo Esporte. 7 November 2023. Retrieved 20 November 2023.-

Data.event_text: 24 March  Twenty-three people are killed in a rainstorm in Espírito Santo and Rio de Janeiro states.

links.text: -"Death toll from heavy rains in southeastern Brazil jumps to 23". ABC News. Retrieved 2024-03-25.-

Data.event_text: 26 April  2024 Porto Alegre fire A fire at a guesthouse in Porto Alegre kills at least ten people.

links.text: -"Fire at Brazil guesthouse leaves at least 10 dead, 11 injured". Reuters. April 26, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2-13 May  2024 Rio Grande do Sul floods At least 147 people are killed from flooding caused by heavy rains in Rio Grande do Sul. At least 127 others are listed as missing and 372 injured, while more than two million people in the state are affected and 600,000 others displaced.[excessive citations]

links.text: -"Temporais no RS: Defesa Civil confirma 66 mortes e investiga outros 6 óbitos" [Storms in RS: Civil Defense confirms 66 deaths and investigates another 6 deaths]. g1.globo.com (in Brazilian Portuguese). 5 May 2024. Retrieved 2024-05-05.-

-"Nível do Guaíba continua subindo e marca 5,3 metros; Porto Alegre tem maior cheia da história" [Guaíba level continues to rise and reaches 5.3 meters; Porto Alegre has the biggest flood in history]. g1.globo.com (in Brazilian Portuguese). 5 May 2024. Retrieved 2024-05-05.-
-"Brazil floods death toll rises to 95". www.panorama.am. Retrieved 2024-05-08.-
-"Death toll from heavy rains in Brazil rises to 100". Reuters. May 8, 2024.-
-"Death toll from floods in Brazil hits 113 as rain returns". Reuters. May 10, 2024.-
-"Brazil's Lula delays state visit to Chile over historic floods". France 24. May 13, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 3 May  The 14 de Julho Dam fails after heavy rainfall in Rio Grande do Sul.

links.text: -"Barragem se rompe com chuvas no RS; mortos no estado chegam a 29" [Dam breaks with rain in RS; deaths in the state reach 29]. noticias.uol.com.br (in Brazilian Portuguese). 2 May 2024. Retrieved 2024-05-03.-

Data.event_text: 17 May  Brazil is awarded the hosting rights for the 2027 FIFA Women's World Cup.

links.text: -"Brazil named as hosts for 2027 Women's World Cup". BBC. 17 May 2024. Retrieved 2024-05-17.-

Data.event_text: 29 May  Brazil withdraws its ambassador to Israel amid criticism over the latter's war in Gaza.

links.text: -"Brazil president withdraws his country's ambassador to Israel after criticizing the war in Gaza". Associated Press. 29 May 2024. Retrieved 2024-05-29.-

Data.event_text: 10 June  2024 Brazil wildfires 32,000 hectares (79,000 acres) of tropical wetland in the Pantanal are affected, a 935% increase in the number of fires over the same period last year. A state of emergency is subsequently declared in the region on 25 June.

links.text: -"Brazil wildfires: Parts of Pantanal wetlands ablaze amid drought". BBC. 10 June 2024. Retrieved 2024-06-11.-
-"State of emergency declared over wildfires in Brazil's Pantanal wetland". NHK. Retrieved 2024-06-26.-

Data.event_text: 25 June  The Supreme Federal Court rules in favor of decriminalising possession of marijuana for personal use.

links.text: -"Brazil's Supreme Court decriminalizes possession of marijuana for personal use". Associated Press. 25 June 2024. Retrieved 2024-06-26.-

Data.event_text: 1 July  Air Europa Flight UX045 makes an emergency landing at Natal Airport after encountering severe turbulence near the Brazilian coast on its way from Madrid to Montevideo. Thirty of the aircraft's 325 passengers and crew are injured.

links.text: -"Plane diverted to Brazil after turbulence injures 30". BBC. 1 July 2024. Retrieved 2 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 5 July  Ten people are killed and 42 others are injured after a bus crashes into a bridge near Itapetininga, São Paulo state.

links.text: -"At least 10 dead after bus crash in Brazil's Sao Paulo state". Reuters. July 5, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 July  2024 Brazil wildfires Wildfires burn 760,000 hectares (1.8 million acres) of the Pantanal, destroying over 4% of Brazil's largest wetland.

links.text: -Barber, Harriet (2024-07-09). "Devastation as world's biggest wetland burns: 'those that cannot run don't stand a chance'". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-07-10.-
-Barber, Harriet (2024-07-09). "Devastation as world's biggest wetland burns: 'those that cannot run don't stand a chance'". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-07-10.-

Data.event_text: 17 July  A massive fishkill suspected to have been caused by the dumping of industrial waste from a sugar and ethanol plant results in the deaths of between 10 and 20 tons of fish in the Piracicaba River in São Paulo state.

links.text: -"Tons of dead fish cover major river in Brazil after alleged dumping of industrial waste". Associated Press. 2024-07-18. Retrieved 2024-07-18.-

Data.event_text: 23 July  A study by the Oswaldo Cruz Foundation finds the first incidence of cocaine discovered in sharks following tests on 13 Brazilian sharpnose sharks off the coast of Rio de Janeiro, in what is believed to be caused by waste from illegal laboratories and users.

links.text: -"Sharks off Brazil coast test positive for cocaine". BBC. 23 July 2024. Retrieved 2024-07-23.-

Data.event_text: The Brazilian government formally issues an apology for the persecution and detention of Japanese immigrants from 1946 to 1948.

links.text: -"Brazil apologizes for post-WWII persecution of Japanese immigrants". Associated Press. 25 July 2024. Retrieved 2024-07-26.-

Data.event_text: The Ministry of Health reports the world's first Oropouche fever deaths from two women in Bahia, escalating the ongoing 20232024 Oropouche virus disease outbreak.

links.text: -"World's first Oropouche virus deaths reported in Brazil". The Telegraph. 2024-07-26. ISSN 0307-1235. Retrieved 2024-07-26.-
-"World's first Oropouche virus deaths reported in Brazil". The Telegraph. 2024-07-26. ISSN 0307-1235. Retrieved 2024-07-26.-

Data.event_text: Leticia Carvalho of Brazil is elected as secretary-general of the International Seabed Authority.

links.text: -"International Seabed Authority elects new secretary general amid concerns over deep-sea mining". Associated Press. 3 August 2024. Retrieved 3 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: Judoka Beatriz Souza wins gold in the over 78 kg category at the Paris Summer Olympics.

links.text: -Pretot, Julien (2024-08-02). Lawson, Hugh (ed.). "Judo-Brazil's Souza wins women's +78kg gold medal". reuters.com. Retrieved 2024-08-07.-

Data.event_text: 3 August  Eight people are killed in an attack by farmers on members of the indigenous Guarani-Kaiowa community in Douradina, Mato Grosso do Sul.

links.text: -"Brazilian authorities reinforce troops after clashes between Indigenous peoples and landowners". Associated Press. 7 August 2024. Retrieved 7 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 5 August  Gymnast Rebeca Andrade wins gold on floor exercise at the Paris Summer Olympics.

links.text: -Thompson, Marcus (2024-08-05). "Rebeca Andrade beats Simone Biles and gets a well-earned Olympic moment". The New York Times. ISSN 0362-4331. Retrieved 2024-08-07.-
-Thompson, Marcus (2024-08-05). "Rebeca Andrade beats Simone Biles and gets a well-earned Olympic moment". The New York Times. ISSN 0362-4331. Retrieved 2024-08-07.-

Data.event_text: 7 August  The Government reports that deforestation in the Amazon Rainforest is at its lowest level since 2016.

links.text: -"Deforestation in Brazil's Amazon rainforest is down to lowest level since 2016, government says". AP News. 2024-08-07. Retrieved 2024-08-08.-

Data.event_text: 8 August  Brazil orders the expulsion of the Nicaraguan ambassador in retaliation for the expulsion of its ambassador in Managua amid a diplomatic row over criticism by President Lula da Silva of the authoritarian regime of President Daniel Ortega.

links.text: -"Brazil expels Nicaraguan ambassador in retaliation as rift between leaders grows". Associated Press. 2024-08-09. Retrieved 2024-08-11.-

Data.event_text: Voepass Linhas Aéreas Flight 2283 crashes in Vinhedo, São Paulo State, killing all 62 people on board.

links.text: -"Brazilian plane crash outside São Paulo kills 61, says airline". CNN. 2024-08-09. Retrieved 2024-08-09.-

Data.event_text: Duda Lisboa and Ana Patrícia win gold for Brazil in women's beach volleyball at the Paris Summer Olympics[citation needed]

17 August  Brazilian investigation into Elon Musk X shuts down its operations with the exception of service accessibility in Brazil following a dispute between the former's owner, Elon Musk and Supreme Federal Court justice Alexandre de Moraes over the blocking of accounts accused of spreading misinformation.

links.text: -"Elon Musk's X to shut operations in Brazil amid bitter legal fight". Al Jazeera. 2024-08-18. Retrieved 2024-08-18.-

Data.event_text: 22 August  2024 Brazil wildfires Nearly 1,500 firefighters are dispatched to contain intense wildfires that are causing dense hazardous smoke to fully "engulf" Porto Velho, with the total number of wildfires in Brazil reaching 59,000 since the start of the year.

links.text: -Watts, Jonathan (2024-08-22). "Brazil sends 1,500 firefighters to combat Amazon forest blazes". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-08-23.-
-Watts, Jonathan (2024-08-22). "Brazil sends 1,500 firefighters to combat Amazon forest blazes". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2024-08-23.-

Data.event_text: 23 August  Two people are killed in a wildfire that his an industrial plant in Urupes, São Paulo State.

links.text: -Mackintosh, Thomas (2024-08-24). "Cities on high alert as Brazil wildfires kill two". BBC. Retrieved 2024-08-25.-

Data.event_text: 27 August  Forty-eight cities issue red alerts for prolonged heavy, hazardous smog coming from extensive wildfires, with Brasília being covered in toxic hazardous smog for two days.

links.text: -"In a rare event, fire smoke covers Brazil's capital, prompting federal response". AP News. 2024-08-26. Retrieved 2024-08-27.-

Data.event_text: 31 August  Brazilian investigation into Elon Musk X is blocked in Brazil after the firm fails to comply with a deadline from Supreme Federal Court justice Alexandre de Moraes to name a legal representative in the country and pay fines.

links.text: -"Musk's X banned in Brazil after disinformation row". BBC. 2024-08-31. Retrieved 2024-08-31.-

Data.event_text: 1 September  The number of wildfires in the Amazon rainforest reaches its highest number in fourteen years at 38,266 fire hotspots as a result of an ongoing drought in South America.

links.text: -"Brazil's Amazon rainforest fires in August reach 14-year high". Reuters. September 1, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2 September  The Supreme Federal Court unanimously upholds justice Alexandre de Moraes' decision to block X in Brazil. De Moraes also sets a daily fine of R$50,000 (US$8,900) for people or companies using VPNs to access the site.

links.text: -"Brazil Supreme Court panel unanimously upholds judge's decision to block X nationwide". AP News. 2024-09-02. Retrieved 2024-09-03.-

Data.event_text: Twenty percent of the Brasília National Forest is destroyed by a wildfire that investigators suspect was started deliberately.

links.text: -"Wildfire destroys 20% of Brasilia forest, arson suspected". Reuters. September 4, 2024.-

Data.event_text: SpaceX removes its employees from Brazil amid ongoing legal issues between CEO Elon Musk and the Supreme Federal Court over Musk's social media company X.

links.text: -"SpaceX Pulls Employees From Brazil, Discourages Travel There, as Musk Battles Court Over X". September 4, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 6 September  President Lula dismisses human rights minister Silvio Almeida following complaints of sexual misconduct against the latter.

links.text: -"Brazil's Lula fires human rights minister accused of sexual misconduct". AP News. 2024-09-07. Retrieved 2024-09-07.-

Data.event_text: 9 September  Fifty-nine percent of Brazil's landmass is reported to be suffering from its worst recorded drought, which also cause historically low water levels in the Amazon basin levels and contribute to at least 160,000 wildfires causing widespread air pollution.

links.text: -"During Brazil's worst drought, wildfires rage and the Amazon River falls to a record low". AP News. 2024-09-09. Retrieved 2024-09-10.-

Data.event_text: 21 September  Three players of the Coritiba Crocodiles American football team are killed after their bus overturns on their way to a match in Rio de Janeiro.

links.text: -"Deadly bus accident claims lives of 3 Brazilian football players". AP News. 2024-09-22. Retrieved 2024-09-22.-

Data.event_text: 23 September  A judge in Pernambuco orders the arrest of singer Gusttavo Lima on charges of money laundering and illegal gambling. The order is suspended the following day by another judge.

links.text: -"Judge orders the arrest of a top Brazilian country music star as part of a money laundering probe". AP News. 2024-09-22. Retrieved 2024-09-24.-
-"Judge suspends arrest order of a top Brazilian country music star amid money laundering probe". AP News. 2024-09-24. Retrieved 2024-09-25.-

Data.event_text: 25 September  Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy accuses Brazil and China of using their proposed peace plan for ending the RussoUkrainian War to boost their geopolitical power "at Ukraine's expense" by urging developing nations to agree to it.

links.text: -"Zelenskiy takes aim at China, Brazil push for peace in Ukraine". Reuters. September 25, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 30 September  A suspect is convicted of obstructing the investigation into the assassination of Marielle Franco and is sentenced to five years' imprisonment.

links.text: -"A man is convicted in the killing of noted Rio de Janeiro councilwoman Marielle Franco". Associated Press. October 1, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 São Paulo mayoral election Reelectionist Ricardo Nunes and federal deputy Guilherme Boulos advance to the second round.
2024 Rio de Janeiro mayoral election Reelectionist Eduardo Paes wins a fourth non-consecutive term and an absolute majority in the first round.
2024 Salvador mayoral election
8 October  The Supreme Federal Court lifts its ban on X after the latter complies with conditions to end its suspension and settles around $5.2 million in fines.

links.text: -"X returns to Brazil after Supreme Court ends disinformation ban". France 24. 9 October 2024. Retrieved 9 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 October  Rosita Milesi, a Scalabrinian nun, is awarded the Nansen Refugee Award by the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, citing her work as a “lawyer, social worker and movement builder” helping internally displaced and stateless people in the past 40 years.

links.text: -"Brazilian nun awarded UN refugee prize". Al Jazeera. 9 October 2024. Retrieved 9 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 12 October  Seven people are killed in an overnight storm in São Paulo State.

links.text: -"Powerful storm knocks out power to 1.4 million homes in Brazil's largest city". Associated Press. 13 October 2024. Retrieved 13 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 23 October  A riot in Rio de Janeiro related to a Copa Libertadores semi-final match between Botafogo and Penarol leads to the arrest of more than 250 Uruguayan supporters of the latter team.

links.text: -"Over 250 Uruguayan football fans arrested after Rio riot". France 24. 24 October 2024. Retrieved 24 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 2024 São Paulo mayoral election (second round) Ricardo Nunes is reelected mayor.

links.text: -Mauricio Savarese (28 October 2024). "Voters in Brazil's largest city reelect mayor, who detaches from Bolsonaro after tumultuous campaign". Associated Press. Retrieved 28 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: One person is killed and 12 others are injured in an attack by Palmeiras ultras on a bus carrying Cruzeiro supporters in Mairiporã, São Paulo State.

links.text: -"Brazilian soccer fan dies after ambush by rival supporters". Associated Press. 28 October 2024. Retrieved 28 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 29 October  The Brazilian Institute of Environment and Renewable Natural Resources (IBAMA) imposes fines totaling $64 million in fines against 23 meatpacking companies and their suppliers, including JBS, for buying and selling up to 18,000 heads of cattle raised illegally on deforested land in the Amazon.

links.text: -"Brazil fines meatpacking companies, including giant JBS, for buying illegally raised cattle". Associated Press. 29 October 2024. Retrieved 29 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 31 October  Two former police officers are sentenced to up to 79 years' imprisonment for the assassination of Marielle Franco in 2018.

links.text: -"Brazil judge gives 2 former cops long sentences for the 2018 murder of leftist icon Marielle Franco". Associated Press. 1 November 2024. Retrieved 1 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 5 November  Valdecy Urquiza is elected as secretary general of Interpol, the first person outside Europe or the United States to assume the position.

links.text: -"Brazilian police official chosen as the next head of Interpol". Associated Press. 5 November 2024. Retrieved 5 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 8 November  A tentative witness in a criminal case involving the Primeiro Comando da Capital is killed in a shooting at São Paulo/Guarulhos International Airport.

links.text: -"1 killed and 3 wounded after gunmen open fire at Brazil's largest international airport". Associated Press. 9 November 2024. Retrieved 9 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 November  Total Linhas Aéreas Flight 5682 A
13 November  A suicide bomber detonates himself and one other bomb near the Supreme Federal Court in Brasília after failing to enter the building. No other casualties are recorded.

links.text: -Jones, Julia Vargas; Regan, Helen (14 November 2024). "Explosives and timer found on suspect's body after attack on Brazil's top court". CNN. Retrieved 14 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 14 November  A court in Belo Horizonte clears Samarco, Vale, and BHP of responsibility over the Mariana dam disaster in 2015.

links.text: -"BHP, Vale cleared by Brazil court over 2015 dam disaster". France 24. 15 November 2024. Retrieved 15 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1819 November  2024 G20 Rio de Janeiro summit

links.text: -"Brazil's G20 summit produces a broad declaration that's short on specifics". Associated Press. 20 November 2024. Retrieved 20 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 19 November  Five members of the security forces are arrested on suspicion of plotting to assassinate President Lula, Vice President Geraldo Alckmin and Supreme Federal Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes as part of a coup d'état.

links.text: -"Brazilian police arrest 5 officers in alleged 2022 coup plot to kill President Lula, others". Associated Press. 19 November 2024. Retrieved 19 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 24 November  A bus falls off a ravine in Alagoas, killing 17 people.

links.text: -"Death Toll In Brazil Bus Crash Revised To 17". Barron's. 24 November 2024. Retrieved 25 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 4 December  Minas cheese is recognized by UNESCO as an Intangible cultural heritage.

links.text: -"Brazil's Minas cheese gets added to UNESCO list". GMA News. 6 December 2024. Retrieved 6 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 December  Three Federal Highway Police officers are convicted and sentenced to between 23 and 28 years imprisonment for the killing of Genivaldo de Jesus in 2022.

links.text: -"Brazil judge gives 3 former officers long sentences for killing of Black man in trunk". Associated Press. 8 December 2024. Retrieved 8 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 14 December  Former defense minister Walter Braga Netto is arrested on charges relating to the 2022 Brazilian coup plot.

links.text: -"Ex-Bolsonaro Cabinet minister arrested in Brazil over alleged coup plot". Associated Press. 15 December 2024. Retrieved 15 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 December  2024 Minas Gerais road crash A multiple-vehicle collision between a passenger bus, a car and a B-double road train in Teofilo Otoni, Minas Gerais, kills 39 people and injuries 7 others.

links.text: -Araújo, Alex (10 January 2025). "Corpos das 39 pessoas que morreram em acidente com ônibus em Minas Gerais são identificados" [Bodies of 39 people who died in bus accident in Minas Gerais are identified]. G1 (in Brazilian Portuguese).-

Data.event_text: 2024 Gramado Piper PA-42 crash A Piper PA-42 crashes into a built-up area in Gramado, Rio Grande do Sul, killing all ten people on board.

links.text: -"Private plane crash in Brazil kills pilot and his family". BBC. 23 December 2024. Retrieved 2024-12-23.-

Data.event_text: A bridge over the Tocantins River connecting Estreito, Maranhão and Aguiarnópolis, Tocantins collapses and takes down ten vehicles along with it, killing 13 people and leaving four others missing.

links.text: -"Acid complicates search after deadly Brazil bridge collapse". France 24. 23 December 2024. Retrieved 2024-12-23.-
-"Brazil's Navy finds the body of the 13th victim of a river bridge collapse; 4 are still missing". Associated Press. 4 January 2025. Retrieved 4 January 2025.-

Data.event_text: 23 December  Three people die after eating a cake laced with arsenic in Torres, Rio Grande do Sul.

links.text: -"Three dead in suspected Christmas cake poisoning". BBC. 29 December 2024. Retrieved 2024-12-31.-
